author: Robert Stickles
subject: Re: the characters
body:
>From: "DANIEL ZELTER" <danielzelter@hotmail.com>

Dan wrote:

>"Lupin France,"
>
>Arsene Lupin is French. However, a cosplayer named Dale suggested to me 
>that
>Lupin the Third is half French, half Japanese.

Dale is correct that Lupin does have Japanese in his background. This 
implies that his mother was Japanese -- we've never seen her nor has she 
been mentioned in the series at all so it's entirely possible.   One of the 
First Series episodes (I think it's _Beware the Time Machine_) shows one of 
Lupin's ancestors as being Japanese, but I always took this to be one of 
Arsene Lupin the 1st's ancestors (shrug).


>"Jigen USA (Chicago),"
>Jigen may be Japanese-American.

We know so little about Jigen that you could form your own theory, and 
Monkey Punch has stayed pretty mum about the subject (perhaps deliberately). 
The common "fled the Chicago mob and changed his name" story is totally the 
work of fans.  The only concrete background we do have on him is that he was 
a bodygaurd for a Russian mobster (_Orders to Assassinate Lupin_).  There 
are a few snippets in the First and Second TV series as well, but they don't 
amount to much.

Regards,
Rob S.
